Title: Preliminary Learning ON Kimchi: PLONK
Description: Kimchi is our new trustless zkSNARK that is based on the PLONK proof system and the Bulletproofs commitment scheme. The goal of this post is to relieve the symptoms produced after reading the former paper.

Title: Performance: Lambda Expressions, Method Groups, and delegate caching - Gérald Barré
Description: In this post, I describe what are the performance implication of using a method group instead of a Lambda expression in C#.

Description: I had a great discussion with Trevor, the CTO of Rakuten Kobo about their use of RavenDB, you can watch it here:

Title: Temporary breakpoint – New feature in Visual Studio 2022
Description: Temporary breakpoint – New feature in Visual Studio 2022 which is time saver and helpful. Temporary breakpoint once it is hit, it's gone.

Title: Exploring Service Bus with Fantasy Football
Description: Setup a Service Bus queue to receive messages detailing when a particular player on a fantasy football team scored a touchdown, use a logic app to receive the messages and send a text message to a fantasy football manager that their player scored.

Title: 307: All in on .NET MAUI
Description: .NET MAUI is here, and Frank is all in on building apps with it! He has started to migrate his apps and shares his journey!

Title: Alexandre Nédélec - Week 20, 2022 - Tips I learned this week
Description: Once again, I found myself forgetting that this can lose context in JavaScript/TypeScript which results in exceptions because this  is undefined. This is probably obvious for most developers but this is not a case I come across often so it's better to write it down so that I have something to refer to next time.

Title: Geometric transformations with OpenCV
Description: In this article, we explore how we can perform image processing with OpenCV and Python.

Title: Implement Azure AD Continuous Access Evaluation (CAE) step up with ASP.NET Core Blazor using a Web API
Description: This article shows how to implement Azure AD Continuous Access Evaluation (CAE) in a Blazor application which uses a Web API. The API requires an Azure AD conditional access authentication context.…

Title: How do Video Games Stay in Sync? An Intro to the Fascinating Networking of Real Time Games.
Description: How do real-time games keep multiple clients in sync even when people drop 200ms+ latencies?

Title: Build a Fast Ecommerce Site With Next.js and Shopify
Description: In this article, we’ll build a simple ecommerce site with Shopify and Next.js hosted on Netlify and see how to use Distributed Persistent Rendering.

Title: Security in MySQL: Part One - Simple Talk
Description: There are several tools available to keep a MySQL database secure. In this article Lukas Vileikis discuses access control and user privileges.

Title: Packaging a WSL Distro to MSIX
Description: In this post I will demonstrate how to export a WSL distro to a .tar file, and how to use the WSL-DistroLauncher to package it to MSIX.   In case you want to know more details about MSIX, or even get some examples about it, please check the post MSIX: Probably you don't know, but you are already usi...

Title: Access to XAML controls in a React Native for Windows application (Part 2)
Description: In the previous blog post I showed one approach to manage a scenario that can't be done in React Native for Windows out of the box: getting access to the native XAML controls behind the JSX ones, so that you can support scenarios like showing a flyout near another control. Title: Tasks, lists, and promises
Description:
Not everything at a big company involves writing code.  Sometimes, you 
have to do a bunch of meta stuff in order to manage the projects.  These 
are two stories of doing exactly that.

Title: Site Reliability Engineering – Monitoring Distributed Systems
Description: We haven't finished the Site Reliability Engineering book yet as we learn how to monitor our system while the deals at Costco as so good, Allen thinks they're fake, Joe hasn't attended a math class in a while, and Michael never had AOL.
